title: RSU Rocker Linkage - Bearing Removal

body.body: If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Raise and Support Rear of Motorcycle
Raise and support the rear of the motorcycle.
Using proprietary straps, secure the motorcycle to a fixed surface.
Support the swinging arm prior to removing the drag link fixings.
Removing the drag link fixings without supporting the swinging arm will allow it to drop.
Failure to support the swinging arm may lead to trapped fingers.
Remove the drag link bearing sleeve and seals. Discard the seals.
Using a suitable proprietary slide hammer bearing extraction tool, remove the drag link needle roller bearings from the rocker link.
